channel.title: Matrix 718
channel.description:
Hello,
i will be short, i have a mac, i have the ip set and compiled but i cant find how to run on mac, plz little help here, and one other thing how do i add objects to the matrix source... thx already i will give ++rep

item.title: Matrix 718
item.dc:creator: @icedroid icedroid
item.description:
@icedroid wrote:

[quote=“jacobr, post:2, topic:450261”]Ok so I don’t have a mac but im gonna have a go at helping you out.

copy this line:
“C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx512m -cp bin:lib/*: com.rs.Launcher true true false

And paste it into the same terminal window as you just compiled (If you got no errors when compiling)

Press enter on this terminal and you should get a message saying your server is now running

As I said I cannot test this method because I don’t own a mac but it may be worth a try

as for your second question:

To add objects go to:
src>com>rs>utils>NPCSpawning.java

Find:
World.spawnObject

There should be a code that looks kinda like this:

What you want to do is change the 17010 to the objectid of the object you want to spawn
then change 3158, 5710 to the coordinates where you want the object which can be found using “::coords” in-game

I hope this helps,
Jacobr[/quote]

well thank you very much sir, but i think i should explain more then i did,

im running the source from my vista laptop, but i want to play on my mac, so ty for the help but i dont wanne run the server on my mac, only the client

and for the second one, i don’t have the file NPCspawing.java in my files, i already looked at NPCspawns, but there is no such code in there, i looked true all my files but can’t find it anywhere, but maybe with this knowing, you can fix my problem, i hope you will replay soon

Read full topic

item.title: Matrix 718
item.dc:creator: @jacobr jacobr
item.description:
@jacobr wrote:

Ok so I don’t have a mac but im gonna have a go at helping you out.

copy this line:
“C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx512m -cp bin:lib/*: com.rs.Launcher true true false

And paste it into the same terminal window as you just compiled (If you got no errors when compiling)

Press enter on this terminal and you should get a message saying your server is now running

As I said I cannot test this method because I don’t own a mac but it may be worth a try

as for your second question:

To add objects go to:
src>com>rs>utils>NPCSpawning.java

Find:
World.spawnObject

There should be a code that looks kinda like this:

What you want to do is change the 17010 to the objectid of the object you want to spawn
then change 3158, 5710 to the coordinates where you want the object which can be found using “::coords” in-game

I hope this helps,
Jacobr

Read full topic
